column4: I'm trying to do data recovery on a corrupt ext3 partition. fsck complains of a bad superblock, but I know the file data is there (I can see it using foremost). Any tips on recovering a badly corrupted ext3 filesystem?
make image first, try testdisk to recover partition, or photorec for data.
done, but I'm not getting a great deal of useful output from carving (photorec/foremost/whatever)
Did you try to mount it?
